data.message:
I'm still being overly sentimental about my mental
State of mind 
How many more lines to complete my ode to you?
It's time for me to pay the tithe and dues
Five years of me trying to integrate with the others
Then one day I cleaned the slate
Thinking about what a normal life would be like 
Late at night is when I would hit the pinnacle of my confidence
It's not by  coincidence  that I would meet her at that time
Too perfect that's why I was uncertain
Some days I felt like an emotional burden
But she reassured me that she would never leave me
Four years later and we are still walking
We would talk to each other all of the time
I remember when  I met her mother in the church's parking lot
At that point,I felt like I was finally in my own limelight
For the first time in my mind,I felt like everything was alright
I know now of all of the things that I can do
I just wanted to say,Thank You

I'm still in shock with all of the locks that I've finally popped
Distilling my thoughts of the victory that I sought 
Not for the fame or the acclaim
Just to make a away for my mother to feel some sweet closure
I made a promised to make a getaway for all of us one day
For you,Sam,Alana,and Taylor
That's why I write until I see my DNA on the paper
Bloody fingers mixed with ink
I don't have to think to succeed
I'll just secede from the damn idiocy
The lost sense of integrity is the detriment of  the babies
That live just to be understood and seen
One last thing,a bad memory is just the past of enemies still living rent free
Thank you
